Package com.linecorp.armeria.client

Class DecoratingClientFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linecorp.armeria.client.AbstractClientFactory
      • com.linecorp.armeria.client.DecoratingClientFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientFactory, AutoCloseable
    public class DecoratingClientFactory
extends AbstractClientFactory
    A ClientFactory that delegates the creation of Clients to another ClientFactory.

    • Method Detail

      • delegate

        protected ClientFactory delegate()
        Returns the delegate ClientFactory.

      • supportedSchemes

        public Set<Scheme> supportedSchemes()
        Description copied from interface: ClientFactory
        Returns the Schemes supported by this ClientFactory.

      • eventLoopGroup

        public EventLoopGroup eventLoopGroup()
        Description copied from interface: ClientFactory
        Returns the EventLoopGroup being used by this ClientFactory. Can be used to, e.g., schedule a periodic task without creating a separate event loop. Use ClientFactory.eventLoopSupplier() instead if what you need is an EventLoop rather than an EventLoopGroup.

      • eventLoopSupplier

        public Supplier<EventLoop> eventLoopSupplier()
        Description copied from interface: ClientFactory
        Returns a Supplier that provides one of the EventLoops being used by this ClientFactory.

      • acquireEventLoop

        public ReleasableHolder<EventLoop> acquireEventLoop​(Endpoint endpoint)
        Description copied from interface: ClientFactory
        Acquires an EventLoop that is expected to handle a connection to the specified Endpoint. The caller must release the returned EventLoop back by calling ReleasableHolder.release() so that ClientFactory utilizes EventLoops efficiently.

      • meterRegistry

        public MeterRegistry meterRegistry()
        Description copied from interface: ClientFactory
        Returns the MeterRegistry that collects various stats.

      • setMeterRegistry

        public void setMeterRegistry​(MeterRegistry meterRegistry)
        Description copied from interface: ClientFactory
        Sets the MeterRegistry that collects various stats. Note that this method is intended to be used during the initialization phase of an application, so that the application gets a chance to switch to the preferred MeterRegistry implementation. Invoking this method after this factory started to export stats to the old MeterRegistry may result in undocumented behavior.

      • newClient

        public <T> T newClient​(URI uri,
                       Class<T> clientType,
                       ClientOptions options)
        Description copied from interface: ClientFactory
        Creates a new client that connects to the specified URI using the default ClientFactory.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI of the server endpoint
        clientType - the type of the new client
        options - the ClientOptions

      • clientBuilderParams

        public <T> Optional<ClientBuilderParams> clientBuilderParams​(T client)
        Description copied from interface: ClientFactory
        Returns the ClientBuilderParams held in client. This is used when creating a new derived Client which inherits ClientBuilderParams from client. If this ClientFactory does not know how to handle the ClientBuilderParams for the provided client, it should return Optional.empty().

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: ClientFactory
        Closes all clients managed by this factory and shuts down the EventLoopGroup created implicitly by this factory.
